feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 7:03AM AKDT until March 17 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Visibilities reduced to one half mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Alaska Peninsula.

entry.title: Freeze Watch issued March 17 at 3:04AM PDT until March 18 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 31 possible. * WHERE...Northwestern Mendocino Interior, Northeastern Mendocino Interior and Northern Lake Counties. * WHEN...From late tonight through Friday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Northern Lake County; Northwestern Mendocino Interior

entry.title: Frost Advisory issued March 17 at 3:04AM PDT until March 18 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 AM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures as low as 35 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Mendocino Coast, Southwestern Mendocino Interior, Southeastern Mendocino Interior and Southern Lake Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 10 AM PDT Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Mendocino Coast; Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Lake County; Southwestern Mendocino Interior

entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Surf of 3 to 6 feet with sets to 7 feet and high rip current risk. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas and Orange County Coastal Areas.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 17 at 1:10AM PDT until March 17 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves of 3 to 6 feet. * WHERE...West facing beaches of the Los Angeles County Coast, and Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles

entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...West and northwest facing beaches of San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara County Central Coast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 2:39PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MODEST SYSTEM WITH LIGHT SNOW AND BREEZES THIS WEEKEND... A fast moving storm system will move across the region this weekend, bringing breezy winds with chances for rain and snow Saturday into Saturday evening, followed by chilly conditions with brisk northwest to north winds Sunday. * SNOW: Projected snowfall amounts 1-3 inches above 5000 feet
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued March 17 at 9:07AM MDT until March 17 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF HEAVY SNOW THROUGH THIS MORNING... .Widespread light to moderate snow will continue over the region this morning. The heaviest snowfall this morning will be focused from Denver south to the Palmer Divide and west into the foothills and another area of heavier snow from Limon to Akron and points east. Roads will be slushy and slick through late morning, especially in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet
